get.description: Returns information for all available policies.

parameters.description: For GET operations, includes deleted policies in the results.
parameters.name: includeDeleted

parameters.description: For GET operations, returns only policies for this particular `cloudletId`. The `cloudletId` for Edge Redirector is `0`, Visitor Prioritization is `1`, Forward Rewrite is `3`, Request Control is `4`, API Prioritization is `5`, Audience Segmentation is `6`, Phased Release is `7`, and Application Load Balancer is `9`.
parameters.name: cloudletId

policyInfo.name: CookieCutter
policyInfo.statusDetail: waiting to complete tests in test environment

schema.description: Policy details and information on each policy's properties.

items.description: Contains information about a shared policy.

cloudletType.description: The two-letter code of the Cloudlet that the shared policy is for. Shared policies are available for API Prioritization (`AP`), Edge Redirector (`ER`), Forward Rewrite (`FR`), Audience Segmentation (`AS`), Request Control (`IG`), and Phased Release (`CD`).

createdBy.description: The username who created the policy.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the policy was created.

currentActivations.description: Information about the active policy version that's currently in use and the status of the most recent activation or deactivation operation on the policy's versions for the production and staging networks.

production.description: The policy version number that's currently in use on this network and the status of the most recent activation or deactivation operation for this policy's versions.

effective.description: The status of the activation that's currently in use on this network, or `null` if the policy has no activations.

apiVersion.description: The specific version of this API.

network.description: The network, either `STAGING`, `PRODUCTION`, or `prod` as shorthand, on which a load balancing configuration for Application Load Balancer has been activated. Values are case-insensitive in requests.

policyInfo.description: Returns details of a policy associated with policy activation.

activatedBy.description: User name who issued the activation.

activationDate.description: Date of the activation in milliseconds.

activationDate.description: Date of the activation in milliseconds.

description.description: A human-readable label for the policy.

groupId.description: Identifies the group. See [About group IDs](ref:about-group-ids).

links.description: Hypermedia links to help navigate through the result set.

items.description: Hypermedia links to help navigate through the result set, or to identify the current item whose `rel` is `self`.

href.description: A relative path to the currently requested object or a specific page of the result set.

rel.description: The relationship between the current and linked result sets. A value of `self` links to the current result set, while `first`, `next`, and `last` link to different sets of paginated data.

modifiedBy.description: The username who last modified the policy.

modifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the policy was last modified.

name.description: The name of the policy. You use this value to refer to a shared policy in Property Manager.

policyType.description: The type of policy. This API lets you create only `SHARED` policies.

post.description: Create a new Cloudlet policy. If a policy already exists with the same policy name, you receive a 409 (Conflict) status response that contains data for the existing policy. New policies are automatically assigned version number 1.

parameters.description: If cloning an existing policy, this parameter is the ID of the policy (`policyId`) you want to clone. If there are attributes that you do _not_ want propagated from the source policy, you must provide the new values in the request.
parameters.name: clonePolicyId

parameters.description: For POST operations, indicates the version of the existing policy to use for the new policy.  If not specified, the latest version of the existing policy is copied.
parameters.name: version

example.description: Testing the creation of a policy
example.name: TestCreatePolicy1

cloudletType.description: The two-letter code of the Cloudlet that the shared policy is for. Shared policies are available for API Prioritization (`AP`), Edge Redirector (`ER`), Forward Rewrite (`FR`), Audience Segmentation (`AS`), Request Control (`IG`), and Phased Release (`CD`).

groupId.description: Identifies the group where you want to create the policy. See [About group IDs](ref:about-group-ids).

name.description: The name of the policy. You use this value to refer to this policy in Property Manager.

policyType.description: The type of policy that you want to create. This API lets you create only `SHARED` policies.

items.description: Hypermedia links to help navigate through the result set, or to identify the current item whose `rel` is `self`.

href.description: A relative path to the currently requested object or a specific page of the result set.

rel.description: The relationship between the current and linked result sets. A value of `self` links to the current result set, while `first`, `next`, and `last` link to different sets of paginated data.

modifiedBy.description: The username who last modified the policy.

modifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the policy was last modified.

name.description: The name of the policy. You use this value to refer to a shared policy in Property Manager.

policyType.description: The type of policy. This API lets you create only `SHARED` policies.

get-policies-response.description: Policy details and information on each policy's properties.

items.description: Contains information about a shared policy.

cloudletType.description: The two-letter code of the Cloudlet that the shared policy is for. Shared policies are available for API Prioritization (`AP`), Edge Redirector (`ER`), Forward Rewrite (`FR`), Audience Segmentation (`AS`), Request Control (`IG`), and Phased Release (`CD`).

createdBy.description: The username who created the policy.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the policy was created.

currentActivations.description: Information about the active policy version that's currently in use and the status of the most recent activation or deactivation operation on the policy's versions for the production and staging networks.

production.description: The policy version number that's currently in use on this network and the status of the most recent activation or deactivation operation for this policy's versions.

effective.description: The status of the activation that's currently in use on this network, or `null` if the policy has no activations.
